snippet: On Lens: An update from the photographer Brenda Ann Kenneally on a longtime subject who still suffers from a poverty-filled and drug-riddled childhood.
abstract: On Lens: An update from the photographer Brenda Ann Kenneally on a longtime subject who still suffers from a poverty-filled and drug-riddled childhood.
lead_paragraph: Brenda Ann Kenneally’s photographs, featured on the Lens blog, document the poverty-stricken life of Andy Velazquez, a boy who grew up on her block in Bushwick, Brooklyn. Her subject and friend was first captured at age 8 and on throughout his tragic adolescence. Raised by a drug-addicted mother, he relied on selling drugs and eschewed school. Ms. Kenneally’s pictures were published in The New York Times Magazine in 2002 and in a book in 2005.

headline.main: Photos Document a Drug-Tainted Life in Bushwick
